{{cpp/string/char_traits/title|not_eof}}
{{cpp/string/char_traits/navbar}}
{{ddcl|notes={{mark constexpr since c++11}}&lt;br&gt;{{mark noexcept since c++11}}|
static int_type not_eof( int_type e );
}}

Given {{c|e}}, produces a suitable value that is not equivalent to {{tti|eof}}.

This function is typically used when a value other than {{tti|eof}} needs to be returned, such as in implementations of {{lc|std::basic_streambuf::overflow()}}.

See {{named req|CharTraits}} for the general requirements on character traits for {{tt|X::not_eof}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|e|value to analyze}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|e}} if {{c|e}} and {{tti|eof}} value are not equivalent, or some other non-eof value otherwise.

===Complexity===
Constant.
